title: Relates to the residency requirement for the village clerk of the village of Aurora, Cayuga county
summary: Relates to the residency requirement for the village clerk of the village of Aurora, Cayuga county.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3672

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 26, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. FINCH -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Local Governments

       AN ACT to amend the village law and the public officers law, in relation
         to the residency requirement for the village clerk of the  village  of
         Aurora, Cayuga county

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 14 of section 3-300  of  the  village  law,  as
    2  added by chapter 373 of the laws of 1999, is amended to read as follows:
    3    14. Notwithstanding any provisions of this chapter or any other gener-
    4  al  law, local law, ordinance or special act, the village board of trus-
    5  tees of the incorporated village  of  Aurora,  Cayuga  county,  may,  by
    6  resolution,  provide that the office of treasurer of such village may be
    7  held by a person who is not a resident of such  village,  provided  that
    8  such  person  resides within the county in which such village is located
    9  or in an adjoining county within the state  of  New  York  AND  MAY,  BY
   10  RESOLUTION, PROVIDE THAT THE OFFICE OF CLERK OF SUCH VILLAGE MAY BE HELD
   11  BY  A  PERSON  WHO IS NOT A RESIDENT OF SUCH VILLAGE, PROVIDED THAT SUCH
   12  PERSON RESIDES WITHIN THE COUNTY IN WHICH SUCH VILLAGE IS LOCATED OR  IN
   13  AN  ADJOINING  COUNTY  WITHIN THE STATE OF NEW YORK.  PROVIDED, HOWEVER,
   14  THE PERSON PERFORMING THE  FUNCTIONS  OF  VILLAGE  CLERK  IN  ANY  OTHER
   15  VILLAGE  SHALL  BE AN ELECTOR OF SUCH VILLAGE, UNLESS OTHERWISE PROVIDED
   16  BY AN ACT OF THE STATE LEGISLATURE.
   17    S 2. Section 3 of the public officers law is amended by adding  a  new
   18  subdivision 58 to read as follows:
   19    58.  IN THE VILLAGE OF AURORA, IN THE COUNTY OF CAYUGA, THE PROVISIONS
   20  OF THIS SECTION REQUIRING A PERSON TO BE A  RESIDENT  OF  THE  POLITICAL
   21  SUBDIVISION  OR  MUNICIPAL  CORPORATION OF THE STATE FOR WHICH HE OR SHE
   22  SHALL BE CHOSEN OR WITHIN  WHICH  HIS  OR  HER  OFFICIAL  FUNCTIONS  ARE
   23  REQUIRED  TO  BE  EXERCISED, SHALL NOT PREVENT A PERSON FROM HOLDING THE
   24  OFFICE OF CLERK OF THE VILLAGE PROVIDED THAT SUCH PERSON RESIDES IN  THE

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01259-01-1

       A. 3672                             2

    1  COUNTY  IN  WHICH  SUCH VILLAGE IS LOCATED OR AN ADJOINING COUNTY WITHIN
    2  THE STATE OF NEW YORK. PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THE  PERSON  PERFORMING  THE
    3  FUNCTIONS  OF  VILLAGE CLERK IN ANY OTHER VILLAGE SHALL BE AN ELECTOR OF
    4  SUCH  VILLAGE, UNLESS OTHERWISE PROVIDED BY AN ACT OF THE STATE LEGISLA-
    5  TURE.
    6    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
